Integrated Management Systems

ISO 9001:2015 – ISO 14001: 2015 – ISO 45001: 2018 – INTERGRATED MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS

ISO implementation
Business implementation of ISO 9001: 2015 (quality); ISO14001: 2015 (environmental) and ISO 45001: 2018 (health & safety) to certification by an external certification body.

  • Gap analysis (ISO 9001: 2015, ISO 14001: 2015 and ISO 45001: 2018)
    Understanding client requirements for ISO implementation through examination of their systems to identify gaps and give recommendations for improvement Internal and external auditing
  • Internally auditing of clients to ensure compliance for external audits
  • Externally auditing with certification bodies as and when required

The Benefits of having an ISO Integrated Management System:

Specialized Services

We have a dedicated team to facilitate and meets the desired skills and demands for any industry.

The team is behind highly-acclaimed projects for established companies. In addition, Innovatius Consultants provides provides professionals to businesses and agencies that need to scale their operations and production at a lower cost.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.9.7″ width=”95%” max_width=”1208px” custom_padding=”4px|||||”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.0.47″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_image src=”http://www.innovatius.co.za/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/process.jpg” align=”center” _builder_version=”4.9.7″ vertical_offset_tablet=”0″ horizontal_offset_tablet=”0″ z_index_tablet=”0″ box_shadow_horizontal_tablet=”0px” box_shadow_vertical_tablet=”0px” box_shadow_blur_tablet=”40px” box_shadow_spread_tablet=”0px”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ disabled_on=”on|on|on” _builder_version=”4.9.7″ vertical_offset_tablet=”0″ horizontal_offset_tablet=”0″ width=”95%” max_width=”1208px” custom_padding=”||7px|||” z_index_tablet=”0″ box_shadow_horizontal_tablet=”0px” box_shadow_vertical_tablet=”0px” box_shadow_blur_tablet=”40px” box_shadow_spread_tablet=”0px” disabled=”on”][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.0.47″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.27.4″ width=”80%” max_width=”1080px”]

Corrosion Protection

Steel is a proven durable and efficient building material that has been used since the Industrial Revolution. It is cost effective, aesthetically pleasing, sustainable, and strong. However, like all metals, steel corrodes when exposed to the atmosphere. Therefore, it is important to consider corrosion protection methods when constructing projects with exposed steel Innovations Consultants can provide a number of different corrosion protection systems.

The most important part of any project is surface preparation. The single most important function that influences coating performance is the quality of surface preparation according to the following:

  • Nace International standards
  • Surface Cleanliness standards
  • ISO standards

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.0.47″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”3.27.4″ width=”80%” max_width=”1080px”]

Coating Fundamentals.

A coating must exhibit a variety of properties to fulfil its role in corrosion protection control.
Corrosion protection surfaces that we work on include:

  • Industrial structural steel
  • Warehouse / factory roofs
  • Commercial metal roofs
  • Silo tanks
  • Reinforced steel bar
  • We work with within various industries including:
  • Industrial companies
  • Commercial companies and on bridges
  • Refineries

All coatings are applied by our experienced staff while full time on-site supervisors monitor quality including health and safety with regular management site visits to ensure compliance is upheld.
